faq.question: What is Megalith?
faq.answer: Megalith is a national-level civil engineering technical fest organized by IIT Kharagpur, focused on innovation, technical skills, and practical exposure in civil engineering and infrastructure.

faq.question: Why is Megalith organized?
faq.answer: Megalith aims to promote innovation in civil and infrastructure engineering, provide hands-on technical exposure, bridge academia and industry, encourage real-world problem-solving, and create a competitive learning environment.

faq.question: Who organizes Megalith?
faq.answer: Megalith is organized by students of the Civil Engineering Department at IIT Kharagpur as a large-scale student-driven technical fest.

faq.question: Who can participate in Megalith?
faq.answer: Undergraduate students, postgraduate students, civil engineering enthusiasts, industry professionals, and startups in infrastructure and construction technology can participate.

faq.question: What kinds of events are conducted in Megalith?
faq.answer: Megalith includes technical competitions, workshops, engineering challenges, and industry interaction sessions.

faq.question: What are Technical Competitions in Megalith?
faq.answer: These are core engineering problem-solving events such as structural design challenges, construction planning competitions, simulation-based contests, and infrastructure problem-solving events.

faq.question: What do Workshops in Megalith focus on?
faq.answer: Workshops focus on civil engineering software tools, design and analysis tools, emerging construction technologies, and infrastructure modeling and data tools.

faq.question: What are Engineering Challenges?
faq.answer: Engineering challenges are hands-on, team-based, time-bound, and application-oriented practical events.

faq.question: What is included under Industry Interaction?
faq.answer: Industry interaction includes guest lectures, panel discussions, and technical talks delivered by experts and professionals.

faq.question: What is the scale of Megalith?
faq.answer: Megalith is a national-level fest and is considered one of the largest civil engineering technical fests in India.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the Megalith website?
faq.answer: The website displays event information, hosts competition and workshop pages, manages registrations, shares schedules and updates, and serves as the official digital platform of the fest.

faq.question: What features does the website include?
faq.answer: Features include event listing pages, event detail pages, a registration system, responsive UI, category-wise navigation, and announcement sections.

faq.question: What technologies are used to build the Megalith website?
faq.answer: The website is built using Next.js, React, and JavaScript with a component-based architecture and modern UI/UX practices.

faq.question: What teams are involved in organizing Megalith?
faq.answer: Teams include the Web Team, Design Team, Event Management Team, Sponsorship Team, and Content Team.

faq.question: What is Anurag Ranjan’s role in Megalith?
faq.answer: Anurag Ranjan has served as Associate Member (2023–2024), Web Team Member (2024–2025), and will serve as Web Head, leading the web team and managing website architecture and development.

faq.question: What skills are applied in Megalith web development?
faq.answer: Skills include frontend development, React and Next.js development, UI structuring, and website architecture planning.

faq.question: What technical value does Megalith provide?
faq.answer: Megalith encourages application of civil engineering concepts, simulates real-world engineering problems, and improves design and analytical skills.

faq.question: What benefits do students gain from Megalith?
faq.answer: Students gain hands-on exposure, teamwork experience, competitive learning, and networking opportunities.

faq.question: How is Megalith relevant to industry?
faq.answer: Megalith provides exposure to modern tools and technologies, supports industry-academia interaction, and focuses on technology-driven civil engineering solutions.
